intro: Eriolaena parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriolaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands, often in well-drained soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and birds.
